bug.author: moured
bug.summary: yolov3-tiny.yaml is not working with yolov5 repo
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
I just cloned the yolov5 repo then added yolov3-tiny.yaml from yolov3 repo. But, it is not working. Details below. <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce (REQUIRED)</denchmark-h>
Input: <denchmark-code>python3 train.py --data models_pool/yolov3_tiny/data.yaml --img 256 --batch 4 --epochs 100 --cfg models_pool/yolov3_tiny/model.yaml --weights '' </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Output:</denchmark-h>
Traceback (most recent call last): File "train.py", line 538, in train(hyp, opt, device, tb_writer, wandb) File "train.py", line 93, in train model = Model(opt.cfg, ch=3, nc=nc).to(device) # create File "/home/yolov5/models/yolo.py", line 85, in init self.model, self.save = parse_model(deepcopy(self.yaml), ch=[ch]) # model, savelist File "/home/yolov5/models/yolo.py", line 253, in parse_model m_ = nn.Sequential(*[m(*args) for _ in range(n)]) if n > 1 else m(*args) # module TypeError: init() takes 2 positional arguments but 5 were given I0102 20:26:53.518604 140082319169344 internal.py:138] Internal process exited <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
ubuntu 18.04 , GPU.

comments.comment:
Hello <denchmark-link:https://github.com/moured>@moured</denchmark-link> , thank you for your interest in YOLOv3! Please visit our <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki#tutorials>Tutorials</denchmark-link> to get started, where you can find quickstart guides for simple tasks like <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/Train-Custom-Data>Custom Data Training</denchmark-link> all the way to advanced concepts like <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/issues/607>Hyperparameter Evolution</denchmark-link> . If this is a üêõ Bug Report, please provide screenshots and minimum viable code to reproduce your issue, otherwise we can not help you. If this is a custom training Question, please provide as much information as possible, including dataset images, training logs, screenshots, and a public link to online <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/Train-Custom-Data#visualize>W&B logging</denchmark-link> if available. For business inquiries or professional support requests please visit <denchmark-link:https://www.ultralytics.com>https://www.ultralytics.com</denchmark-link> or email Glenn Jocher at <denchmark-link:mailto:glenn.jocher@ultralytics.com>glenn.jocher@ultralytics.com</denchmark-link> . <denchmark-h:h2>Requirements</denchmark-h>
Python 3.8 or later with all <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/blob/master/requirements.txt>requirements.txt</denchmark-link> dependencies installed, including . To install run: $ pip install -r requirements.txt <denchmark-h:h2>Environments</denchmark-h>
YOLOv3 may be run in any of the following up-to-date verified environments (with all dependencies including <denchmark-link:https://developer.nvidia.com/cuda>CUDA</denchmark-link> /<denchmark-link:https://developer.nvidia.com/cudnn>CUDNN</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://www.python.org/>Python</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://pytorch.org/>PyTorch</denchmark-link> preinstalled):
Google Colab Notebook with free GPU: Kaggle Notebook with free GPU: https://www.kaggle.com/ultralytics/yolov3 Google Cloud Deep Learning VM. See GCP Quickstart Guide Docker Image https://hub.docker.com/r/ultralytics/yolov3. See Docker Quickstart Guide
<denchmark-h:h2>Status</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/workflows/CI%20CPU%20testing/badge.svg></denchmark-link>
If this badge is green, all <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/actions>YOLOv3 GitHub Actions</denchmark-link> Continuous Integration (CI) tests are currently passing. CI tests verify correct operation of YOLOv3 training (<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/blob/master/train.py>train.py</denchmark-link> ), testing (<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/blob/master/test.py>test.py</denchmark-link> ), inference (<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/blob/master/detect.py>detect.py</denchmark-link> ) and export (<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/blob/master/models/export.py>export.py</denchmark-link> ) on MacOS, Windows, and Ubuntu every 24 hours and on every commit.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/moured>@moured</denchmark-link> yolov3-tiny is actually available directly within the YOLOv5 repo in models/hub: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/tree/master/models/hub>https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/tree/master/models/hub</denchmark-link>
To start training with it: git clone https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5 # clone repo cd yolov5 pip install -r requirements.txt # install dependencies python train.py --cfg yolov3-tiny.yaml --weights '' # yaml file searched automatically within yolov5/

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/moured>@moured</denchmark-link>
 this bug has been resolved and both yolov5 and yolov3 (<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/commit/865e046e11783bf13fba71634b26a3260bd90c5a>865e046</denchmark-link>
) repos have received a fix. Please git pull to receive these fixes and try again, and let us know if you spot any other issues!
